MajorClaims.MC1: being present at classes seems a wiser option
MajorClaims.MC2: communicating and studying with peer group is a good way for learning materials

Claims.C1: being present at classes provide students with opportunity of communicating with other students that is beneficial for understanding new material by reviewing them throughout the free times in college
Claims.C2: by the help of teachers, students can understand ideas faster and easier
Claims.C3: appearing in class makes students more conscientious
Claims.C4: teachers have a conspicuous role in assisting students for learning materials that being present at classes is a requisite for benefiting it
Claims.C5: attending to classes makes students more attentive and have them to do their studies on time that this attitude lead them to success

Premises.P1: they can help each other for learning materials better
Premises.P2: if they do not attend classes they cannot use the help of others for assisting them to comprehend difficult problems
Premises.P3: teachers explain them thoroughly in the class and after that give them a lot of examples to clarify the points
Premises.P4: In this way attending classes not only wastes their time but also facilitates their understanding process that takes them less time for comprehending materials in comparison with self-study
Premises.P5: they have to obey class’s disciplines and they practice to be more perseverance in the process of doing their assignments
Premises.P6: the ones who choose to study at home do not have any discipline for their studies and cannot force themselves to study in particular times
Premises.P7: they may miss some important parts in virtue of the chaotic and incoherent study
